intro: Rourea ivorensis, commonly known as the Ivory Coast rourea, is a shrub or small tree native to western Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are often glossy and dark green. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in cyathia, typical of the spurge family. Its bark is thick and corky, and it is sometimes used in traditional medicine. Rourea ivorensis is adapted to tropical climates and can thrive in a variety of soil types.
